required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of CS0159 in Chinese Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single Ascending Does/ Mulelple Ascending Does Study of CS0159 to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokynetics, and Food Effect in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase I clinical bridging trial, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, single ascending does/ mulelple ascending does study of CS0159 to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokynetics, pharmacodynamices, and food effect in Chinese healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of Serious Adverse Event (SAE), Adverse Event (AE) resulting in treatment discontinuation, and AE of special interest, from baseline up to 15 days.
Evaluate the Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve.
analysize the plasma Concentration relevance to QTcF

arm_group.description: One tablet daily for seven days.
Two tablet daily for seven days.
Three tablet daily for seven days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy adult subjects of 18 years to 55 years.
2. Weight: Male≥50kg, female≥45kg BMI: 18~32kg/m².
3. In good health, determined by having no clinically significant findings from medical history, physical examination, 12-lead ECG, vital signs measurements, and clinical laboratory evaluation.
4. Subject signs IFC and dates and subject must understand and follow test procedures and restrictions.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects with special dietary requirements and cannot follow a uniform diet.
2. Pregnant or nursing females or females who have pregnancy plans during the trial or within 3 months after the trial.
3. Any subject with SARS-CoV-2 infection, based on a positive polymerase chain reaction for SARS-CoV-2.
4. History or evidence of clinically significant disorder, condition, or disease that, in the opinion of the investigator, would pose a risk to subject safety or interfere with the study evaluations, procedures, or completion.
